sense.name: (cause to) move or go quickly
sense.examples: He sped/speeded down the hall to receive his guests. The train sped/speeded along at over 120 miles per hour. The actress then sped away in a waiting car. We sped down the ski slopes. This year is speeding by. Ambulances sped the injured people away from the scene.

sense.name: (cause to) increase the speed or rate of, accelerate
sense.examples: The new software speeded the production rate significantly. The best thing you can do to speed your recovery is to rest. I noted the car sped/speeded up and overtook me on the right. The network sped/speeded up the second phase of the process.

sense.name: drive at an excessive or illegal velocity
sense.examples: I got a ticket for speeding last Thursday. Next time you speed, I'm going to tear up your license. You hear?
